text:
September 10, 1962
Dr. Harry J. Skomla
Professor of Radio and Television
24 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry%
In answer to your scribbled set of interrogations, I
hasten to supply answers of a sort. (If you have forgotten
what the questions were, it’s Just too badi).
1* This was merely the working of the cyclic-response
mechanism: growing tensions followed by a blowoff, followed
by a period of innocuous desuetude. Evidently Riblcoff got
things into such a muddle that he thought it would be the
lesser of evils to get Into the Senate. We don’t know much
about the new man, except that he was instrumental In bringing
some order out of the chaos in Cleveland so they can apparently
go ahead now. Walter evidently felt that he could no longer
compromise his principles with decisions that were being made
above him and which he had to accept whether he liked It or
not. He chose, therefore, to be a free man and go back to the
groves of academe. He probably will be succeeded by Seth
Spaulding, who Is a good man and is Walter’s own choice as his
successor.
2. Lee Dreyfus more or less succeeds me as Manager of
WHA-TV. There is still room for me somewhere in the total
setup, if I choose to come back next year. The sudden ascendency
of ray friend Harrington to the Presidency of the University
of Wisconsin, has altered my outlook a bit. When It was an¬
nounced that he was going to the University of Hawaii as Its
President, I about decided that this had tipped the scales in
favor of my staying in Washington. Now I must re-evaluate in
terms of this new development and what Harrington’s adminis¬
tration might do to really advance television at Wisconsin. Lee
accepted the job with the understanding that I might return,
but that there would be room for both of us. Lee will teach
part time In the Speech Department. McCarty stays on as Director
of the Division of Radio-Television Education, of which WHA-TV
is a part.
